Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. Fal

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people

I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that tho

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one. In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites are allowed t

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one. Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news wit

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be noth

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people a

A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.

I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of worl

In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?

If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version

A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives.  I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the

With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in lif

With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the e

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fi

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. Thi

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make thes

As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any les

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citiz

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simplay

In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, s

A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying i

---

In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do

I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

I would love to see everyone up to date on world an

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

I would love to see everyone up to date on world and national even

If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

I would love to see everyone up to date on world and national events. I understa

As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

I would love to see everyone up to date on world and national events. I understand, howeve

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.

I would love to see everyone up to date on world and national events. I understand, however, that this sim

Are We Being Bad Citizens If We Don't Keep Up With the News?

In your opinion, are we being bad citizens if we don't keep up with the news? Do you think all people have some responsibility to know what is going on in the world? Does engaging with current events actually do anything at all? Why do you think the way you do?

---

In my opinion, this is a tough topic to take a stand on. I had written in favor of keeping up on the news in the past, but would like to change my stance and see where that leads. I don't think it is necessarily prudent for everyone to keep up with current events. The issue we have today is that people aren't always getting their news from reliable sources. If you don't know the difference between news, entertainment, and junk, it can be a big problem to know what is true and not. With the prevalence of social media and the actual lies that are stated as factual news on such sites, people getting and then believing misinformation can lead to real issues. In my opinion is it worse to believe news that is incorrect than to not have any information at all. False beliefs can lead to one person telling tens and hundreds of people and so one.  A lie repeated 100 times is far more believable than the truth told only once. With that thought, rumors can become reality and people don't really end up knowing the news anyhow.
So how do we keep up with current events, but avoid the junk?
 I think this is almost impossible in today's world. As long as social media sites allow people to post anything they want, some of the items declared as news will continue to be nothing more than garbage. I don't think people are bad citizens if they don't keep up with the news. I think we should try to be informed of world events, but that isn't always possible in our hurried lives. There is still the old tried and true way of getting news from friends and relatives. This can lead to also getting their version of news, tainted with their opinions, but it is still a way to pass on information. For some people, who cannot afford the luxuries in life of time to sit and watch the news, or the education level to sort out fact from fiction, passing on of events from family is all the have. This doesn't make these people any less of a good citizen or responsible person. We all try to do what we can. Simply stated, sometimes trying is the best we can do.
